title: Fix landing page generation in llmService and wire it to the app

requirements.text: Fix the landing page project type flow so that when a user selects 'Landing Page' in NewSessionPage and sends a message in ChatPage, the llmService returns a complete, working landing page scaffold (HTML structure, hero section, features, CTA, and styles) instead of failing silently or producing no output.

quotes: it did work but not able to create landing page

acceptanceCriteria: Selecting 'Landing Page' as project type and submitting a prompt in ChatPage produces a non-empty AI response with code files.
The llmService landing page template returns at least one code file (e.g., index.html or App.tsx) with a complete landing page scaffold.
The generated response includes a hero section, a features/highlights section, and a call-to-action.
No console errors or blank responses occur when the landing page project type is used.

requirements.text: Ensure the landing page template in llmService.ts generates a visually polished scaffold that matches Noventra.Ai's dark theme (OKLCH color tokens, glassmorphism, Space Grotesk font) and includes sections: Hero, Features, How It Works, and CTA with appropriate copy about Noventra.Ai building any project app.

quotes: Make a landing page for noventra.AI informing it is app can make any project app mobile app or landing p...

acceptanceCriteria: The landing page template output contains Hero, Features, How It Works, and CTA sections.
Copy reflects that Noventra.Ai can generate any project type: full-stack apps, mobile apps, and landing pages.
Styles reference the existing dark theme color tokens and Space Grotesk font.
The generated scaffold is valid, renderable code.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ (immutable paths).
Keep all backend logic in backend/main.mo â€” no backend changes are needed for this fix.
nonGoals: Adding external API calls or live AI model integrations to llmService.
Changing the backend canister or session management logic.
Creating a new route or page beyond what already exists.
